column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////Coming from the East Coast I've never been a huge fan of deep-dish
column2: but I had to have some while I was in Chicago.  I was aware these pizzas take a while to cook
column3: but Lou's was definitely worth the wait.  On ordering
column4: I chose "butter crust" over "dough crust" (I wasn't really sure what the difference would be and just rationalized that butter might taste better)
column5: and I was not disappointed.  Some of the pizza photos of other local favorites just struck me as gooey incoherent messes of cheese
column6: but this pizza was well balanced in all elements
column7: so I can see how it could appeal to a wide base when there are so many tough critics out there with different tastes.
